snippet: Saddam Hussein’s interior minister was released from prison on Monday after serving eight years for his role in the government’s decision to drain the southern marshlands in the 1990s.
abstract: Mahmoud Diab al-Ahmed, interior minister under Saddam Hussein, is released from an Iraqi prison after serving eight years for his role in the government’s decision to drain the southern marshlands in the 1990s.
lead_paragraph: Saddam Hussein’s interior minister was released from prison on Monday after serving eight years for his role in the government’s decision to drain the southern marshlands in the 1990s.

headline.main: Iraq: Hussein’s Interior Minister Is Released From Jail
headline.print_headline: Iraq: Hussein’s Interior Minister Is Released From Jail
